Key Match Events: Harry Wilson played a one-two to break into the Finland box and fired a shot at goal, which was saved but knocked into the path of David Brooks, who made no mistake with his finish.
Neco Williams lashed a free-kick into the net.
Teemu Pukki pulled a goal back for Finland just before half-time.
A defensive howler gave Daniel James a free run at the goalkeeper to tuck it away for the fourth goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Southampton forward Brooks was decisive for the Welsh as he grabbed the important early opener to give his team a boost and rattle their opponents. He then helped ensure they restored a comfortable lead when he found Johnson in space to smash home their third.

Finland winger Daniel Hakans did not have the best of matches for the away side. He saw one wayward effort miss the target in the first half and then slipped as he challenged Ethan Ampadu for the header and ended up playing Johnson onside, letting Wales kill the game off.
